t: Psalm 69
Save Me, O God
To the choirmaster: according to Lilies. Of David.
Save*pn me, O God! For*ld the waters have come up to my neck.
I*ln sink in deep mire, where*ld there is no foothold; I*ln have come into deep waters, and*ld the flood sweeps over me.
I*ln am weary with my crying out; my*ld throat is parched. My*ln eyes grow dim with*ld waiting for my God.

More*pn in number than the hairs of my head are*ld those who hate me without cause; mighty*ln are those who would destroy me, those*ld who attack me with lies. What*ln I did not steal must*ld I now restore?
O*ln God, you know my folly; the*ld wrongs I have done are not hidden from you.
Let*pn not those who hope in you be put to shame through me, O*ld Lord God*s of hosts; let*ln not those who seek you be brought to dishonor through me, O*ld God of Israel.
For*ln it is for your sake that I have borne reproach, that*ld dishonor has covered my face.
I*ln have become a stranger to my brothers, an*ld alien to my motherâ€™s sons.
For*pn zeal for your house has consumed me, and*ld the reproaches of those who reproach you have fallen on me.
When*ln I wept and humbled my soul with fasting, it*ld became my reproach.
When*ln I made sackcloth my clothing, I*ld became a byword to them.
I*ln am the talk of those who sit in the gate, and*ld the drunkards make songs about me.
But*pn as for me, my prayer is to you, O Lord.*s At*ld an acceptable time, O God, in*ld the abundance of your steadfast love answer me in your saving faithfulness.
Deliver*ln me from*ld sinking in the mire; let*ln me be delivered from my enemies and*ld from the deep waters.
Let*ln not the flood sweep over me, or*ld the deep swallow me up, or*ld the pit close its mouth over me.
Answer*pn me, O Lord,*s for your steadfast love is good; according*ld to your abundant mercy, turn to me.
Hide*ln not your face from your servant, for*ld I am in distress; make haste to answer me.
Draw*ln near to my soul, redeem me; ransom*ld me because of my enemies!
You*pn know my reproach, and*ld my shame and my dishonor; my*ld foes are all known to you.
Reproaches*ln have broken my heart, so*ld that I am in despair. I*ln looked for pity, but there was none, and*ld for comforters, but I found none.
They*ln gave me poison for food, and*ld for my thirst they gave me sour wine to drink.
Let*pn their own table before them become a snare; and*ld when they are at peace, let it become a trap.
Let*ln their eyes be darkened, so that they cannot see, and*ld make their loins tremble continually.
Pour*ln out your indignation upon them, and*ld let your burning anger overtake them.
May*ln their camp be a desolation; let*ld no one dwell in their tents.
For*ln they persecute him whom you have struck down, and*ld they recount the pain of those you have wounded.
Add*ln to them punishment upon punishment; may*ld they have no acquittal from you.
Let*ln them be blotted out of the book of the living; let*ld them not be enrolled among the righteous.
But*pn I am afflicted and in pain; let*ld your salvation, O God, set me on high!
I*pn will praise the name of God with a song; I*ld will magnify him with thanksgiving.
This*ln will please the Lord*s more than an ox or*ld a bull with horns and hoofs.
When*ln the humble see it they will be glad; you*ld who seek God, let your hearts revive.
For*ln the Lord*s hears the needy and*ld does not despise his own people who are prisoners.
Let*pn heaven and earth praise him, the*ld seas and everything that moves in them.
For*ln God will save Zion and*ld build up the cities of Judah, and*ln people shall dwell there and possess it;
the*ld offspring of his servants shall inherit it, and*ld those who love his name shall dwell in it.
